name: Green Tea
history: Green Tea, with its origins in China, has been consumed for thousands of years and is renowned for its health benefits. It has since become popular worldwide and is known for its delicate flavor and antioxidant properties.
description: Green Tea is a type of tea made from Camellia sinensis leaves that have not undergone the same withering and oxidation process used to make oolong teas and black teas. It's known for its subtle, delicate flavor and is often enjoyed for its health benefits.

instructions.title: Heat the Water
instructions.description: Heat water in a kettle until just before boiling. The ideal temperature for green tea is between 160-180Â°F (70-80Â°C).

instructions.title: Steep the Tea
instructions.description: Place the green tea leaves or tea bag in a teapot or cup. Pour the hot water over the tea. Allow it to steep for 2-3 minutes.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Remove the tea leaves or tea bag. If desired, add honey or lemon to taste. Serve the green tea warm.

tips: Avoid using boiling water as it can make the tea taste bitter.
Adjust the steeping time according to your taste preference. Longer steeping can result in a bitter taste.
variations: Experiment with adding flavors like mint, jasmine, or ginger.
Try cold brewing by steeping the tea in cold water for an extended period.

storage.shelfLife: Best consumed immediately. Can be refrigerated for up to 24 hours if cold brewed.
storage.instructions: Store in a refrigerator if not consumed immediately.

reheatingInstructions: Gently reheat on the stovetop or in a microwave, but do not boil.
presentationTips: Serve in a clear glass or teapot to enjoy the color of the tea.
Garnish with a fresh sprig of mint or a slice of lemon.
